result.execSummary:
The defendant Hycel D Buford was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:

AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit Random Urine Screens.

Any valid prescription drugs must be taken in the manner in which they are prescribed.

Provide DNA Sample If not yet provided and Pay Surcharge.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Hycel D Buford in court, in custody, with attorney Robert W. Buckett.   Barbara A. Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

The Court Orders the Following:

COUNT 1
Imposed Sentence of

3 Years 6 months Imprisonment (Credit - 0 days )
- 1 Year  6 months of Initial Confinement
- 2 Years of Extended Supervision

Conditions of Extended Supervision:
- AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
- Absolute Sobriety; Random U.A.s;
- No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia;
- No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
- Any valid prescription drugs must be taken in the manner in which they are prescribed;
- Inform agent of all prescriptions;
- Sign Medical Release for Agent;
- Obtain/Maintain Full time employment;
- Perform  20 hours of community service each year of extended supervision with the last 20 hours to be completed prior to the last 60 days of extended supervision;
- Provide DNA sample if not yet provided  and pay surcharge

DL Revocation:  6 months

Costs: $268.00 
DNA Surcharge:  $250.00

Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program

COUNT 3 

Imposed and Stayed Sentence

6 months Jail  STRAIGHT TIME - Consecutive to COUNT1  Credit - 0 days

Term of Probation: 2 years  CONSECUTIVE TO COUNT 1

Conditions of Probation:  SAME AS COUNT 1

Costs:  $243.00
DNA Surcharge:  $200.00


Costs and Surcharges to be paid during extended supervision/ probation at the rate of $50.00   per month commencing on the 120th day of release onto extended supervision. )
Sentencing hearing on December 8, 2014 at 01:45 pm.

Defendant Hycel D Buford in court, in custody, with attorney Robert W. Buckett.   Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Defendant enters a guilty plea to Counts 1 and 3.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Counts 2 and 4 are dismissed and read in.  State requests a PSI.    Court orders a PSI.  Court revokes bail.  

Felony warnings, immigration warnings,  voting rights and firearms warnings given.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 8, 2014 at 01:45 pm.
IT IS ORDERED Attorney Buckett is allowed to see his client immediately to prepare for the 1:30 plea and sentencing on 9-30-14.  signed by Judge Bohren on 9-30-14
from defendant
